description: As a person who switched from windows last year, I always missed the Task Manager it had, and this brings it back perfectly, the UI is lovely and (in my case) it even includes disk, ethernet, and GPU readings. Will be using it as my go to app for monitoring my system.
summary: Best app for monitoring system resources

description: This shows me everything I am used to from the Windows Task Manager on Ubuntu...keeping this for as long as it works!
I came for GPU usage since System Monitor doesn't have it but this makes a great alternative

it is really easy to use and understand. The services tab and the GPU support, and the "disk active time" support is also really really useful. 
Windows task manager is pretty neatly done, and this does the same for linux, even better.
for customization, one can use "system monitr" from plasma

Great design. All useful information that i need (also gpu info).
Apps are separeted from processes ! Its that real must-have function for ALL task managers

I tried dozens of system monitors, the default one in kde, gnome, stacer, and found all of these to be lacking, compared to Windows Task Manager, where I'm coming from LOL. Now I found this gem. It has everything I could wish for & more in an intuitive & user-friendly package, including dark mode. It even shows things you'll not find in the windows task manager, such as power draw & memory speed.
summary: Oh my goodness I've been looking for something like this for ages!

description: This should be the default for any distro
This app is absolutely amazing for newcommers from Windows.
For months i looked for a good system monitor, and finally theres one that has features and doesn't suck.
Turns out, Linux apps do misbehave often enough that for me as a recent Windows migrant, this app was heaven sent!
useful tool monitor cpu and gpu.
Really nice overview of systemd services as well as cpu, memory, drive, network & gpu utilization.
Just Great! Very clean!
Has everything, works flawlessly.

Amazing App.
Not only does it feel like a complete system monitoring tool (Except Event Logs), but its fast and works great!!!

Imho this should be made the default for GTK DE's. A QT version would be awesome for Plasma
Remind me again, why this app is not preinstalled on every Gnome base DE?
I hope gnome will replace system monitor with this app in the future
It is very similar to task manager, but that's not a bad thing. It's well formated and works well for the uses I need. Great work!
It is a great app, but it consumes a lot of VRAM on my AMD Radeon™ 680M even when it is set to use 2 GB VRAM.

The performance dashboard is very detailed but not overwhelming at the same time, the app view has both a detailed process tree and a simple app list (grouping multi-process apps together). And it's all very snappy.
summary: The best system monitor I ever seen

description: Absolutely insane how an app like this has gone unnoiticed. Crazy props to the developers!
summary: The Holy Graile of Linux Monitoring

description: The graphs alone are amazing. For some reason on my system, the apps section isn't showing any apps or processes
Need to download
however it is very feature deprived and there is nothing you can do inside other then look at nice graphics
summary: finally a normal gnome system monitor

description: works fine but looks pretty bad since it is just a 1:1 windows task manager clone, and microsoft is knows for their terrible ui design

Detailed and good looking displays/graphs for all the stats you could need. I love that it looks good on the gnome desktop. Good way to monitor, and the dev promised more features to come (end process isn't available at the time of writing) 
It looks nicer than the built in system monitor (it groups open apps seperately from other background processes), but it's less useful right now.
summary: Simple, Good Looking, Updates to come

description: Dammit, I want this to be the default system monitor on gnome
summary: Didn't know I needed this until I saw it

description: Provides heaps of information in a very easy to read way
summary: Very Detailed, no problem with my NVIDIA GPU either

description:
I'm a developer and love tinkering with Linux, but sometimes I just want a functional system without using the command line. I've been looking for a nice system monitor app for ages at this point and finally found this just browsing Flathub. Wonderful app, looks great! 

P.S. I wonder what inspired this app..... lol
summary: Great Task Manager alternative for Linux!

description: it looks almost identical to the windows 10 one (which is a good thing) I much prefer it to gnome system monitor. it makes the info much clearer. my apps/processes doesn't seem to work though (might be a flatpak thing)
Is look like the windows 8.1 or windows 10/11 task manager!
Linux has been needing a good alternative to Task Manager for a while and I think this might be it. The simplicity and utility is all there. Miles better than the GNOME default.
summary: One of the best System Monitors

description: It displays GPU stats (RX 6800) perfectly. Temp, VRAM usage, Power Draw. I think this will replace "System Monitor" and "radeontop" for me.
Looks nice in Gnome.

Functionality-wise, this is a fantastic app, especially for the GPU section, which shows a lot of useful info such as utilisation, memory usage, power consumtion, memory clock, etc. The Gnome VItals extension does not include such GPU information so I use this app to monitor my GPU.

I have removed 2 starts for the following reasons (ordered in ascending importance):
1. Ethernet is shown even when a cable is not connected.
2. The GPU section only works for dedicated GPUs. It seems it does not appear for iGPUs.
3. The most major for me issues: the design is copied directly from the windows task manager. I don't appreciate this design and it does not fit with the Gnome look.
for those who are used to windows task manager
summary: for those who are used to windows task manager

description: This sounds like advertising but if you install this app once, you will like it immediatley. This is the best monitoring app I have ever used in Linux. Everything is so clear, detailed and well designed. Thank you developers!
It's much better than htop and Gnome System Monitor

Its a funny tool, for its near resemblance of Windows Task Manager, and quite descriptive on the Memory side than any available in the default repos, but i think it cant identify Intel iGPU at the moment, i hope the Update should adress that soon.

As someone who uses Windows 10 on their desktop PC, I appreciate having the consistency between OSes for this type of program. Mission Center provides the same info in the exact same way as task manager and it works very well so it's perfect for me!

The Task Managers or whatever it's called on linux have always been lacking. the one on kde is ok, but not great. gnome system monitor is just a gtk3 skin of the top command. Windows has always been miles ahead in this department for as far back as anyone can remember. It really was the only feature I was missing from my switch from windows a few years ago. No need to change perfection, just skin it. this is also the first system monitor on linux that i have used that gives me any info about my GPU which is very important since I'm constantly wrestling with nvidia drivers. Nice, 5 stars
summary: Only Thing I Missed On Windows

description: all ok. buena informacion da.
Wht it uses so much RAM? :D Uninstalling it. Trash sofwtare.

Even though is a near clone to the Windows Task Manager, I like the features available so far and I give it 5 stars because of that.

I would like a couple more features like CPU temperature, but I guess these will come with time.

Overall is a good candidate to replace GTKStressTesting, NVTop and Gnome System Monitor for my use cases.

It works well with my NVIDIA GPU and it I can see the overall CPU usage or look at it per logical processor. I wish the apps list were more useful though. For example, I would like to be able to kill a process from within the app.
Finally a good system monitor

I love this pice of software. It is already in a very good state. However to become perfect it has still a way to go, as it is still lacking some features if compared to its inspiration referencce. 

However the biggest problem I have with this software is its name. It neither easy to rember, nor is it descriptive or in any other kind of way a good name. The name needs either to have something with "task", or "system" in it, or it should be completely different but then atleast easy to rember. "Mission Center" is amongst the worst naming decisions I have seen in the last 10 years.
summary: Awsome software but the name is bad

description: in beautiful libadwaita! incredibly well done
I have been looking for a task manager equivalent in linux and this is the closest, good job!

While still in development mission center has prooved to be both pretty and useful, it fits perfectly with the rest of my system and I can easily check for system usage it also directly works with my nvidia GPU no setup required (though my amd IGPU shows constant 100% usage).

you can also manage some processes, it would be nice if you could also send different signals to processes or monitor a single process.
summary: Finally a good GTK system monitor!

description: Amazing app. love the gpu support
summary: Amazing app. love the gpu support

description: Easily the most promising system monitor/task manager out there. Fantastic in its current form with lots of potential. Well done!
Perfect app. Just one thing missing: CPU Temp, I have an Intel, Idk about Ryzen.
It's very nice and works well, I wish it included some features from system-monitor, like an overview and per-CPU usage graphs.
This is the nicest system monitor for Linux that I have ever used. I love how it separates desktop apps from system processes, and the performance graphs look great! Amazing work
summary: This should be the default GNOME system monitor

description: Works as expected. Everything included what I need.
Very nice and simple task manager in the style of the Windows 11 one and it's even better cause it got some nice animations ;D
summary: The best Windows program on Linux

description: Mission Center not only looks great as an GTK4 app and therefore looks nicer and way more modern than the standart System Monitor and it also has way more information like GPU usage. I realy don't mind that it is vissualy very close to the Windows Task Manager. So overall usefull and good looking app.
summary: Looks greate and has a lot of information

description: I usually struggle to find how much browser uses the ram try to add up... Good feature.
summary: Love the merge of parent and child process

description: The libadwaita interface looks great, and over time the features have been getting better, so now it's at the point where I prefer it over any other system monitor app. Supports both CPU and GPU monitoring, both for the entire system and per process. Huge thanks to the dev team and I'm hoping for their continued development and support for this app!

The app does no more than replicate the Windows CtrlShiftEsc window, which is clear, simple and really useful for most people.


However, the app consumes 1.3GB of system memory, which seems unusually high, compared to other system monitors, such as the standard Gnome System Monitor (only 120MB).
It works as expected, gives way better insight (which makes sense) than the default System Monitor. Appreciate the work.
But I would LOVE a dark mode option

Procurei por muitos gerenciadores de tarefas gráficos com suporte a GPU e que me desse suporte para gerenciar os processos de forma rápida e simples. O Mission Center faz tudo com muita leveza, não toma muito da CPU e apresenta de forma gráfica tudo o que você precisa saber sobre seu sistema.
The UI take inspiration from Windows's task mngr but improved even better

king of the hill !

gpu and cpu. and more.

best sofeware.
amazing interface that shows useful information and lets you close applications now so even better :D
Looks great, easy to use and works flawlessy.
I have to give this one star because the app fails to load for me at all. DBus call 'GetGPUStaticInfo' failed after 3 retries. I wonder if this is due to me using an egpu setup?

As a longtime windows user and now fulltime LINUX, i have to admit this is a great system monitoring application , Cause the default system monitor app that comes preinstalled in gnome desktop enviorments like Ubuntu and others Are not user-freindly interfacable at all. Im glad i found this app, Keep up the great work cant wait for a future update , AND ITS A FLATPAK just Awesome 5-STARS for me.
best app to see gpu utilization

Tried on Fedora 39 and it is just really nice! Shows all the informations I wanted to see, esp. regarding the disk drives and its reading/writing speed.

Thank the dev for the app!
This has been my go to on my PC Desktop Case with integrated LCD! Having the Temps for the GPU and all other stats there has made this the replacement for Plasma's System Monitoring! Amazing Job!

Mission Center comprehensively bests the venerable System Monitor in terms of features and UI design. Linux finally has a graphical monitoring app that is as good as(arguably better) than Windows task manager. 
The only downside is that it seems to use a lot more RAM compared to System Monitor, but it's also doing a lot more and using OpenGL accelerated graphs. It would be nice to see improvements, but I think it's a fair trade off as is.
summary: The best graphical system monitor for linux

description: I can see eerything

This software works great and gives you a windows like Task Manager to be able to see everything that is going on with your system. It works better than the standard system monitor in that it takes into account Cacheing with the RAM so you know how much RAM you are actually using without having to use free -h in the terminal. It also gives you information on how much you storage drives are being accessed, something not given in the included system monitor. They way it list the running apps is intuative and tells you what spawn what so you are able to know what is running without having to be an expert. It is a great application.
I really love that they show hardware decoding while streaming videos.
Gives windows task manager vibes, but with a better organization of information. Somewhat customizable, though missing some more advanced options.
Really needs a "night mode" option.
Always felt we were lacking something like this. Works as expected, reponsive design. Earned a place in my dash.
Extremely useful and pretty. Reminiscent of the classic task manager from Windows
I'm a noob coming from windows, and this app make me feel like home
It's a very nice resource manager that shows all important information in a clean and organized way.
this is EPPPPPPPYC! see what i did there? lol
I have tried a ton of task managr type apps and this is the only one that does everything i want one of these apps to do, thank you to those who worked on this project.

The UI is clean, simple, and informative. It might help if the text was scaled down alongside the window because shrinking the window can make it very crowded. This app is beautiful and if it were up to me would be the GNOME default app over system monitor.

I have used and tried pretty much every system monitor app for Linux and for me, this is the best app bar none. All I can say is that this works like a charm on Fedora Silverblue. 

Try it, you will love it.

Truly one of the best resource monitoring apps I've used to date. While the app is almost a direct copy of Windows' Task Manager, to that I say "if it ain't broke don't fix it". In fact, the Mission Center 'fixes' Windows' task manager significantly: making the app more adaptive, cleaning up the UI, etc. While not all the functionality is replicated, not all of it needs to be. This is a resource monitoring/managing app first and foremost that doesn't try to include superfluous features in the name of simplicity and ease of use. 

To put it bluntly, Mission Center makes GNOME's stock resource monitor look like an archaic piece of technology that should've been left back in 2013.
summary: Rivals the utility of Windows' Task Manager

description: It looks exactly like Task Manager on Windows, but better looking thanks to the consistency provided by libadwaita
Geil endlich was gutes
Super wie Windows

El monitor de sistema mas completo que he encontrado/usado en linux, solo falta que despliegue apropiadamente las aplicaciones y procesos abiertos y poder matarlos, esta ecrito en rust lo cual le da puntos extra. en resumen Excelente sigan asi.
summary: Me gusta más que el monitor por defecto de gnome, es mas competo

description: Funciona perfectamente.
Ojala se convierta el por defecto en gnome

Simpler, clearer and more powerful than nvtop/bashtop I use to launch. 
Manages GPU + CPU + network + Tasks + RAM + Disks! All-in-One!
Блин почему я раньше не знал о таком диспечере. Просто класс.
Есть пожелания попасть вам в стандарты в Gnome, их родной системный монитор страшный и урезанный какой то.
И мне это нравится
summary: Выглядит как диспетчер задач из винды, но на libadwaita

description: ИМХО самый удачный дизайн. Именно такой и искал
Super easy to use.
summary: Very userful for a windows user!

description: 很不错，这笔原有的好用多了。啊啊啊啊啊啊啊啊啊啊啊啊啊啊啊
非常Windows。Linux下终于也有个好用的任务管理器了
在plasma桌面的界面是gnome的样子，很不契合
